definition: To deceive or mislead someone through the use of confident and assertive behavior, often with the intention of gaining an advantage or intimidating others. This term is commonly employed in situations where individuals attempt to bluff or trick others, typically in games, negotiations, or competitive scenarios.

examples.english: He always bluffs when playing poker.

examples.german: Sie bluffte, als ob sie ein Ass auf der Hand hätte.
examples.english: She bluffed as if she had an ace in her hand.

examples.german: Du kannst nicht bluffen, wenn du keine guten Karten hast.
examples.english: You can't bluff if you don't have good cards.

examples.german: Er bluffte, um seine Gegner einzuschüchtern.
examples.english: He bluffed to intimidate his opponents.

examples.german: Sie bluffen oft, um ihre Schwächen zu verbergen.
examples.english: They bluff often to hide their weaknesses.
